Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects (such as stars, galaxies, planets, and more) and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. It involves physics, mathematics, and chemistry to explain their origin and evolution. Astronomy also explores the properties, interactions, and motions of celestial bodies and the physical laws that govern them. Key areas include solar astronomy, stellar astronomy, planetary science, and cosmology. Telescopes and spacecraft are used to observe and study these objects. Astronomy has shaped our understanding of the universe, from the discovery of exoplanets to the big bang theory.
